snippet: More than 20 people, including top legislators, senior governing party figures, officials at Banco do Brasil and businessmen, were originally sentenced more than a year ago.
abstract: Brazil's Supreme Federal Tribunal rules that the powerful figures in the governing Workers Party convicted in vote-buying scheme must soon start their prison terms; decision is a surprising twist in a country where corrupt lawmakers have long been sheltered from punishment.

byline.contributor: Lis Horta Moriconi and Taylor Barnes contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: More than 20 people, including top legislators, senior governing party figures, officials at Banco do Brasil and businessmen, were originally sentenced more than a year ago.

headline.main: Key Brazilians in Graft Case Must Go to Jail, Court Says
headline.print_headline: Key Brazilians in Graft Case Must Go to Jail, Court Says

keywords.value: Dirceu de Oliveira e Silva, Jose
keywords.name: persons
